text: I've always been kind of amused by the
term character actress because one hopes
that every actor plays a character right
otherwise you've just been yourself so I
think I play all kinds of different
characters so I guess that's the kind of
actress I in the 1980s Glenn Close went
from being a rising star on Broadway to
one of the biggest superstars in
Hollywood three Emmys two Golden Globes
and six Oscar nominations later the
actress is coming back to Broadway for
the first time in 20 years this fall
miss clothes will lead a high-powered
cast in the play a delicate balance
Edward Albee's dark comedy about the
fears that live within an upper-middle
class home have you not been in in
theatres or on Broadway for 20 years I
really felt the need to come back just
to get back to the basics of my craft
I've always felt that doing movies is
like one long rehearsal because you have
as many takes as you and the director
think are necessary in order to capture
a certain moment in theater you hope to
give a seamless performance from the
beginning to the end that leaves the
audience with something and I think
theater in the end the training I got in
theatre has really deeply informed my
movie roles I'm ready for my close-up
well I've always tried to stretch myself
that's one of the reasons why I get
attracted to certain roles right after

there's something very moving about
